item.title: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Blapmanjr:

sorry but what is a simon solver ive never came across 1before

Plays the game Simon for you.

Game Link:

Neave Interactive

Neave Interactive

A collection of games, apps and art made by Paul Neave.

[quote=“Weibs, post:43, topic:10348”]It records the colors that simon presses in the game this is made for. It then completes the sequence perfectly, at least it did for me.

By the way, I ran it over night, but my mom came in and was like ‘Why is your computer running?’ and she exited out of everything so I didn’t get a progress report, but it was till flashing from what I could see.[/quote]
Aww that’s too bad.

Read full topic

item.source: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!

item.title: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Janilabo:

Sorry Ron about the off-topic… At least we are bumping and making your topic active.

Don’t be sorry. I really don’t care about off topic stuff.

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:36, topic:10348”]Wow, nice script. I love the game idea.

Do you mind if i make one aswell? For fun. No upstagement intended, there’s just not many flash things to script lately. (Probably is, i just don’t want to find them.)[/quote]
I don’t mind at all man. Do whatever you like with my scripts. Whatever I post, is open source (obviously, but I also mean anyone can do everything with it).

[quote=“Zorlin, post:34, topic:10348”]A[quote author=Ron link=topic=15113.msg177097#msg177097 date=1156285041]
I meant to write M. Your commit charge is telling you, that you are running

366,000,000 kBITS and I was talking about 300 kBYTES. A Kbyte is 1000 Kbits. Sorry for the confusing though. So for you I meant, 300 M.
[/quote]
Actually, A Megabyte is 1000 Kbytes.
A Megabit is 1000 Kbits.
8 bits to a byte,
1024 bytes to a kbyte, 1024 kbytes to an mbyte, and so on. Hope that helped. :P[/quote]
Ehh whatever. Glad you cleared it up though.

Read full topic
item.source: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!

item.title: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

80 MB [~150 ]flash games, oh and I included also Flash Player, which is about ~800 KB… So umm give me about 30 minutes((slow internet))… And is RapidShare OK(started uploading for it)?

There is easy, medium and hard ones… I mean as in scripting mind… I am sure you’ll find nice ones from this package. For about 92-97% of these games you can make scripts (if not for ALL).

Click HERE to download ~80 MB flash games. (For learning purposes :))

Some of the games open full screened. But if you press ESC, the game(s) will go windowed, so it’s not a problem. Anyways there is only about 7 games which are full screened when you start em. But like I said, it’s not a problem[just press ESC, then].

Sorry Ron about the off-topic… At least we are bumping and making your topic active.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:27, topic:10348”]erm ok my commit charge is like this: 365M / 2460M…
lol please tell me the m’s arent mills…

edit: i went to the “performance” tab and it says cpu usage 2%, and pf usage 366mb[this is what u ment right?][/quote]
M = megabyte
K = kilobyte
M = 1024 * K
that answer your question?

Read full topic
item.source: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!

item.title: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Updated the script one last time, and now everythign is perfect thanks to Pwnd for pointing out a small problem where I had 4 infinite loops set up without any waits to check when a color was lit so as to detect them. But it was running without any wait which was increasing CPU Time. So now it should be a little faster and easier.

This script sure got more advanced. I added Sounds, DebugInfo, Status Checks, Simon Checks, and loads of other stuff since v.1.

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Simon Solver v.31 by Ron! NO BUGS!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

bullzeye95:

Ron I code without comments. I remember what everything is, or figure it out by looking at it.

Woop Tee Doo.

davidude36:

lol when i was scripting i put comments in, but when iwent back to fix a script i couldnt figure out what in the world i ment by my comments…

Solution: write better comments lol.

bullzeye95:

Yea I have had like 80 running when I tested it… so, I’ll just keep the waits in there.

80 is abnormal. I’m running 28, with BitTorrent, Firefox, firewall and antivirus. If you have realshed.exe,jusched.exe, quicktime, or msn and you’re not using quicktime or msn at the moment, then disable those. 80 is really abnormal.

davidude36:

hmm my computer isnt what i’d call slow… nothing lags at all, well i will sort it out in the morning (yes i woke up again couldnt sleepzorz) instead i watched timothy dalton try to be james bond…

Go into TaskManager, and look at the Commit Charge. If the commit charge is more than 300k then your computer is slower and you need to bump up the speeds of the waits in the script. If you’re below 300k, then you can use the faster clicks.

Read full topic
